article.title: Poor Peering: a reflexion about a RIXP

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1.1 illustrate about the Mascarene Islands?
choices: The number of Internet Service Providers (ISPs) on each island.
The geographical distribution of Internet Exchange Points (IXPs).
The submarine cable network connecting the islands to the internet.
The average latency between each island and major internet hubs.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the brightness of the cells in Figure 1.2 represent?
choices: The number of submarine cables connecting each island.
The geographical distance between the islands.
The volume of internet traffic exchanged between islands.
The theoretical latency between islands if a RIXP is in Madagascar.
The round-trip time (RTT) for data transmission between two points.
The geographical distance between two points on the Earth\'s surface.
The optimal routing path for internet traffic between two locations.
The impact of a RIXP on reducing latency between two islands.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is significant about equation 1.4 compared to equation 1.3 for the study\'s context?
choices: It accounts for the speed of light in a vacuum.
It specifically considers destinations within the Indian Ocean Area.
It incorporates queuing and processing time in latency calculation.
It is derived from measurements taken from Reunion Island only.
